assignment_title: ECS 152A Project 1: PCAP Analysis, iPerf Client, and Proxy Server Implementation

mini_tasks.task: Create a task outline and pseudocode for Part 1a: Live network traffic monitoring activities

Perform network activities (ping google.com, visit example.com, httpforever.com, tmz.com, access ftp.gnu.org FTP server, SSH into CSIF machine) while capturing live network traffic with Wireshark; save each capture as a separate Pcap file (non-PcapNg)

Write Python scripts using dpkt library to analyze each Pcap file from live traffic and extract: application layer protocols, counts, HTTP/HTTPS packet counts for activities 2 and 3, destination IP addresses with timestamps, and infer browser used for activities 2, 3, and 4
Run Python analysis scripts on live traffic Pcap files and collect the outputs needed for the report
Download the three provided pcap files (PCAP1_1.pcap, PCAP1_2.pcap, PCAP1_3.pcap) and write Python scripts to analyze PCAP1_1.pcap for secret data; produce output and prepare explanation
Analyze the second and third provided pcaps (PCAP1_2.pcap and PCAP1_3.pcap); identify and describe the captured network activities in the report
Draft Part 1 report sections including methodology, protocol counts, secrets found, and activity identifications; document Python code and Pcap filenames
Outline Part 2: UDP iPerf server and client implementation with expected data flow and throughput calculation logic
Implement UDP server Python script to receive 100 MB data, measure throughput, and send throughput back to client
Implement UDP client Python script to send 100 MB data to server and print received throughput
Test UDP server and client locally; verify throughput measurement and output correctness
Plan Part 3: Proxy server, client and server TCP socket implementations with JSON message format and IP blocklist logic
Implement TCP proxy server Python script to receive JSON requests from client, forward to server if not in blocklist, else respond with 'Error'
Implement TCP server Python script to receive messages and respond with pong
Implement TCP client Python script to send JSON messages to proxy server and print responses
Test proxy server setup end-to-end: client→proxy→server communication including IP blocklist cases
Write Part 2 and Part 3 report sections including code file names, design decisions, and results
Assemble final report containing all parts properly formatted with student names, code listings names, Pcap file names, answers to all prompted questions; perform final proofreading
Package all Python scripts, Pcap files, and final report into a zipped submission file and upload to Canvas before deadline
